				StaticText '路'
				[948] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/-/issues/2#note_306780'
					[949] time 'Jul 27, 2021 10:22am EDT'
						StaticText '3 years ago'
				StaticText 'Author'

				[958] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[963] button 'Reply to comment'
				[965] button 'Edit comment'

				[991] paragraph ''

						StaticText 'Created by: aarongustafson'
				[993] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'Thank you!'
			[996] listitem ''
				[999] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					[1000] image 'Byte Blaze', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon'
				[1004] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					StaticText 'Byte Blaze'
				[1007] link '@byteblaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					StaticText '@byteblaze'
				StaticText '路'
				[1013] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/-/issues/2#note_306770'
					[1014] time 'Sep 9, 2021 9:55pm EDT'
						StaticText '3 years ago'
				StaticText 'Owner'
				[1022] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[1027] button 'Reply to comment'
				[1029] button 'Edit comment'
				[1032] button 'More actions'
				[1051] paragraph ''
					StaticText '@aarongustafson I was wondering if I could get your opinion. Prism uses an absolutely positioned stripe to draw the highlight effect. This means that it sits on top of the underlying code content.'
				[1052] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'The highlight effect comes from a semitransparent background color, which is transparent enough to let someone see the underlying content. The problem is a treatment that is transparent enough to see code is also faint enough that it would fail color contrast, meaning a person may not know the highlight is present. Making it more opaque means that the opposite happens, the code becomes not high enough contrast.'
				[1053] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'To get around this, I was playing with a border treatment to indicate the highlight bounds. What do you think of something like this?'
				[1054] link 'Sample HTML code, where one line is highlighted with a top and bottom border.', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/uploads/733ccd6320540243cf9b9a2ec9ae0558/132786353-7ce6b482-5d9d-4620-bdd7-47a3a991a3be.png'
					[1055] image 'Sample HTML code, where one line is highlighted with a top and bottom border.', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/uploads/733ccd6320540243cf9b9a2ec9ae0558/132786353-7ce6b482-5d9d-4620-bdd7-47a3a991a3be.png'
				[1056] paragraph ''
					StaticText "I had a darker color palette for the class tokens worked out, but I can't crack how to get child elements to pop out from underneath something absolutely positioned like this."
			[1059] listitem ''
				[1062] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root'
					[1063] image 'Administrator', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/e64c7d89f26bd1972efa854d13d7dd61?s=80&d=identicon'
				[1067] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root'
					StaticText 'Administrator'
				[1070] link '@root', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root'
					StaticText '@root'
				StaticText '路'
				[1076] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/-/issues/2#note_306779'
					[1077] time 'Sep 10, 2021 4:52pm EDT'
						StaticText '3 years ago'
				StaticText 'Author'
				StaticText 'Contributor'
				[1086] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[1091] button 'Reply to comment'
				[1093] button 'Edit comment'
				[1096] button 'More actions'
				[1119] paragraph ''
					[1120] emphasis ''
						StaticText 'Created by: aarongustafson'
				[1121] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'Its a challenge for sure. I dont dislike the borders, but Im curious: could you apply a'
					[1122] code ''
						StaticText 'backdrop-filter'
					StaticText 'to either invert or hue-rotate the highlight? Normally Id shy away from'
					[1123] link 'a feature that only has ~70% support globally', url='https://caniuse.com/css-backdrop-filter'
					StaticText ', but given that code samples are more likely to be viewed by folks on a more modern browser (except Firefox), maybe its ok? Or maybe one with the other as a fallback (upgraded via'
					[1124] code ''
						StaticText '@supports'
					StaticText ')?'
			[1127] listitem ''
				[1130] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					[1131] image 'Byte Blaze', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon'
				[1135] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					StaticText 'Byte Blaze'
				[1138] link '@byteblaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					StaticText '@byteblaze'
				StaticText '路'
				[1144] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/-/issues/2#note_306774'
					[1145] time 'Sep 10, 2021 4:54pm EDT'
						StaticText '3 years ago'
				StaticText 'Owner'
				[1153] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[1158] button 'Reply to comment'
				[1160] button 'Edit comment'
				[1163] button 'More actions'
				[1182] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'Oh, I'
					[1183] emphasis ''
						StaticText 'love'
					StaticText 'that idea. Will play around a bit with it this weekend, thank you!'
			[1186] listitem ''
				[1189] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					[1190] image 'Byte Blaze', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/99a4297c867eada2606b9b6973f081f9?s=80&d=identicon'
				[1194] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					StaticText 'Byte Blaze'
				[1197] link '@byteblaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'
					StaticText '@byteblaze'
				StaticText '路'
				[1203] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/-/issues/2#note_306771'
					[1204] time 'Sep 13, 2021 10:47am EDT'
						StaticText '3 years ago'
				StaticText 'Owner'
				[1212] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[1217] button 'Reply to comment'
				[1219] button 'Edit comment'
				[1222] button 'More actions'
				[1241] paragraph ''
					StaticText 'So, the good news is that'
					[1242] code ''
						StaticText 'backdrop-filter'
					StaticText "cracks the child element issue. The bad news is the color contrast algorithm won't honor just a 180掳 flip for inversion or rotation. Dark type on light is ranked differently, so adjustments that get one color working may cause others to fail."
				[1243] paragraph ''
					StaticText "Because of that I'm going to take the border approach, at least until something like"
					[1244] code ''
						StaticText ':has()'
					StaticText 'becomes available.'
			[1247] listitem ''
				[1250] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root'
					[1251] image 'Administrator', url='https://www.gravatar.com/avatar/e64c7d89f26bd1972efa854d13d7dd61?s=80&d=identicon'
				[1255] link 'Administrator', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root'
					StaticText 'Administrator'
				[1258] link '@root', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/root'
					StaticText '@root'
				StaticText '路'
				[1264] link '3 years ago', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze/a11y-syntax-highlighting/-/issues/2#note_306777'
					[1265] time 'Sep 13, 2021 10:56am EDT'
						StaticText '3 years ago'
				StaticText 'Author'
				StaticText 'Contributor'
				[1274] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[1279] button 'Reply to comment'
				[1281] button 'Edit comment'
				[1284] button 'More actions'
				[1307] paragraph ''
					[1308] emphasis ''
						StaticText 'Created by: aarongustafson'
				[1309] paragraph ''
					StaticText "Ah, that's a shame. Did you try hue rotation at all?"
			[1312] listitem ''
				[1315] link 'Byte Blaze', url='http://127.0.0.1:8023/byteblaze'

					StaticText '@byteblaze'
				StaticText '路'

					[1330] time 'Sep 13, 2021 11:01am EDT'

				[1338] button '', hasPopup='menu', expanded=False
				[1343] button 'Reply to comment'
				[1345] button 'Edit comment'

				[1367] paragraph ''
					StaticText "Yeah. I couldn't find a value that would satisfy everything, unfortunately."
